column2: justaptient, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: i occasionally take benadryl before bed if i have been having problems sleeping and need a good nights sleep. i can justify taking it because i also have allergies and can become quite congested when i lay down at night especially when pollen and ragweed are in season so i have to sleep with two pillows. i suggest having at last 8 hours to rest or you will wake up drowsy. it usually wears off completely after about 10 hours for me. works fairly well for insomnia most of the time but does not always work. but i figure its better than taking ambien or xanax, which are both pretty potent and addicting.

column9: Took this for a week due to SEVERE allergies (nothing else helped!) And I got fast/irregular heartbeats, trouble breathing. So bad I took myself to the Urgent Care and they scripted me Allegra. 1 day w/ no benadryl so far and no more anxiety/hb issues. Allegra is helping w/ the allergies too! column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Hives from bedbug bites.  Benadryl stops the itch for about 4 hours per 25mg pill. The stuff is magic.  Histamine causes capillaries to be porous enough to leak plasma, but not hemoglobin.  This is where swelling comes from.  A histamine blocker like Benadryl (or any diphenhydramine hydrochloride) blocks the hystamine receptors and prevents the reaction.  It doesn't cure the reason for hives, but makes the itch go away real good.  Plus drowsy.

column2: robin Fairchild, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I self-prescribed benadryl for myself due to serious insomnia.  It definitely worked, giving me a very good night's sleep.  But the downside is I believe it badly trashed my short-term memory.  And I read a report on another website that it was indeed potentially quite harmful in this regard.  So regretfully I discontinued the benadryl.  But it did work quite well when I used it and I am sorry it has had this effect on my memory.On a side note I was prescribed Lunesta by a sleep clinic doctor.  It also worked quite well but had a similar effect on memory.  So I had to give that up.  And now I take nothing for my insomnia and am usually sleep-deprived during the day.
